question.title: flutter pub get and flutter clean take too long to run in Android Studio terminal
question.body:
I'm experiencing an issue in Android Studio where commands like flutter pub get and flutter clean are taking an unusually long time to execute when run from the terminal. This significantly slows down my development workflow.

Here are some details about my setup:

  1. OS: Windows 11

  2. Flutter plugin version: 85.1.3

  3. Android Studio version: Android Studio Meerkat | 21.0.5

Things I've tried:

  1. Restarting Android Studio

  2. Running the commands in an external terminal (still slow)

  3. Checking internet connectivity (everything else works fine)

  4. Updating Flutter and Android Studio to the latest versions

Has anyone else experienced this issue? Are there any tips or configurations that might help speed things up?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

answers.body: Sometimes, terminal processes may take time due to low CPU configuration or too many environment path configurations. Perform all these operations from your IDE (Android Studio) instead.

question_comments.body: It is confusing to say you have updated Android Studio to the latest and saying at the same time that your setup is Android Studio Meerkat | 21.0.5. Either way, how big is your computer in terms of RAM and CPU? Those may be the problem if your computing resources are not enough
